* Main application class for the Mochi CLI chatbot.
/** Directory name for persistence data (relative to project root). */
/** Save file name used by {@link Storage}. */
* Creates a Mochi instance and loads tasks from disk.

*

If loading fails, Mochi starts with an empty task list.
// In case your Storage.load() never throws, this still keeps Mochi robust.
* Runs the chatbot in a read-eval-print loop (REPL).
* Saves tasks to disk and warns if saving fails.
* Executes a parsed command against the current task list.
* @return {@code true} if the task list changed and should be saved.
case BYE -> false; // handled in run()
* @param shouldMark True to mark done, false to unmark.
private boolean markTask(int index, boolean shouldMark) {
* Parses user input into structured commands for Mochi.

*

This class converts raw CLI strings (e.g. {@code "deadline read book /by 2026-01-30"})
* into a {@link ParsedCommand} object that contains:

*
  • an optional 0-based index for commands like mark/unmark/delete

*
  • an optional {@link Task} object for commands that create tasks

*

Design note: This is a utility class (no instances). All parsing logic is centralized
* here to keep UI and storage responsibilities separate.
/** Date-time format accepted for event times: {@code yyyy-MM-dd HHmm}. */
* Prevents instantiation of this utility class.
* Supported user commands recognized by the parser.
LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, BYE
* Represents a parsed command produced from user input.

*
  • {@code task} is non-null only for TODO/DEADLINE/EVENT; otherwise {@code null}

*
  • {@code keyword} is non-null only for FIND; otherwise {@code null}
* @param index   0-based index for index-based commands, or -1 if not applicable.
* @param task    Parsed task for add commands, or null if not applicable.
* @param keyword Keyword for find command, or null if not applicable.
public record ParsedCommand(Command command, int index, Task task, String keyword) {
* Parses raw user input into a {@link ParsedCommand}.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the input is empty, malformed, or unknown.
case "mark" -> new ParsedCommand(Command.MARK, parseIndex(trimmed), null, null);
case "unmark" -> new ParsedCommand(Command.UNMARK, parseIndex(trimmed), null, null);
case "delete" -> new ParsedCommand(Command.DELETE, parseIndex(trimmed), null, null);
* Parses a 1-based index from commands such as {@code "mark 2"} and returns it as 0-based.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If index is missing, not a number, or <= 0.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Index must be a number", e);
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If format is invalid or date cannot be parsed.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Deadline date must be yyyy-MM-dd", e);
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If format is invalid, date cannot be parsed,
throw new IllegalArgumentException("/to must be after /from");
"Event date/time must be yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (e.g. 2026-01-30 1800)", e);
* Handles persistence of {@link Task} objects by loading from and saving to disk.

*

The save file is stored at {@code .//} and each task is stored
* on its own line using a pipe-delimited format:

*
  • {@code E | 0 | description | yyyy-MM-dd HHmm | yyyy-MM-dd HHmm}

*

Corrupted or malformed lines are skipped during loading to keep the application robust.
/** Regex used to split save-file fields separated by {@code |}, allowing surrounding spaces. */
/** Date/time format used when reading and writing event start/end values. */
* Creates a {@code Storage} that reads from and writes to {@code ./<dataDirName>/<fileName>}.
* @param dataDirName Directory name (relative to project root).
* Loads tasks from disk into a {@link TaskList}.

*

If the save file does not exist, an empty task list is returned.
// Ignore corrupted lines to keep loading resilient.
// If read fails, return empty rather than crashing.
* Saves the given task list to disk by rewriting the entire save file.

*

If the parent directory does not exist, it will be created.
public void save(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Parses one save-file line into a {@link Task}.

*
  • {@code E | 0 | description | yyyy-MM-dd HHmm | yyyy-MM-dd HHmm}
* @param line One line from the save file.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the line is malformed or contains invalid data.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event end must be after start");
default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unknown task type: " + type);
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad date/time format", e);
* Applies the done flag ({@code 1} or {@code 0}) to the given task.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code doneField} is not {@code 0} or {@code 1}.
private static void applyDoneFlag(Task task, String doneField) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad done flag: " + doneField);
* Represents a deadline task that must be completed by a specific date.
* where {@code <byDate>} is stored in ISO-8601 format ({@code yyyy-MM-dd}).
/** Output format used when displaying the deadline date to the user. */
/** The deadline date for this task. */
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline date.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code description} is {@code null} or blank, or {@code by} is {@code null}.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Deadline date cannot be null");
* Returns the user-facing string representation of this deadline task.
* @return Display string in the format {@code [D] [X] description (by: MMM d yyyy)}.
* Returns the save-file representation of this deadline task.
* @return Storage string in the format {@code D | <doneFlag> | <description> | yyyy-MM-dd}.
* Represents an event task that occurs within a specific time range.
* {@code [E] [X] description (from: MMM d yyyy, HH:mm to: MMM d yyyy, HH:mm)}

*

Invariant: {@code to} must be strictly after {@code from}.
/** Output format used when displaying event date/time to the user. */
/** Save format used when persisting event date/time to disk. */
/** The start date/time of the event. */
/** The end date/time of the event. Must be strictly after {@link #from}. */
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the given description and time range.
* @param from The start date/time of the event.
* @param to The end date/time of the event.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code description} is {@code null} or blank,
*                                  if {@code from} or {@code to} is {@code null},
*                                  or if {@code to} is not strictly after {@code from}.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event /from and /to cannot be null");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event /to must be after /from");
* Returns the start date/time of this event.
* Returns the end date/time of this event.
* Returns the user-facing string representation of this event task.
*         {@code [E] [X] description (from: MMM d yyyy, HH:mm to: MMM d yyyy, HH:mm)}.
* Returns the save-file representation of this event task.
* Represents a generic task with a description and a completion status.

*
  • provide their own task-type prefix when saving (e.g. {@code T | ...})
/** Task description as entered by the user. */
/** Indicates whether the task is marked as done. */
* Creates a task with the given description. New tasks are unmarked by default.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code description} is {@code null} or blank.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Task description cannot be null/blank");
* Marks this task as not completed.
* Returns whether this task is marked as done.
* Returns the string representation of the task used for displaying in the list.
* @return Display string in the format {@code [X] description} or {@code [ ] description}.
* Returns the task data in a format suitable for writing to the save file.

*

Subclasses should typically override this to prepend a type code
* (e.g. {@code T |}, {@code D |}, {@code E |}) and append any extra fields.
* @return Storage string containing at least the done flag and description.
* Returns whether this task matches the given keyword (case-insensitive).
* @return True if the description contains the keyword.
* Represents the in-memory collection of {@link Task} objects.

*

{@code TaskList} provides basic operations used by the chatbot such as adding,
* retrieving, removing, and marking tasks. It intentionally keeps logic minimal and
* delegates task-specific behaviour (e.g., formatting, done state) to {@link Task}.

*
  • {@link #asUnmodifiableList()} should be preferred for read-only iteration.
*   <li>{@link #asList()} returns the underlying mutable list for persistence usage
* (e.g., {@link mochi.storage.Storage}) and should be used carefully.
* Adds a task to the end of this task list.
* Returns the task at the given 0-based index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If {@code index} is out of range.
* Removes and returns the task at the given 0-based index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If {@code index} is out of range.
* Marks the task at the given 0-based index as done.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If {@code index} is out of range.
* Unmarks the task at the given 0-based index as not done.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If {@code index} is out of range.
* Returns the number of tasks currently in this list.
* Returns {@code true} if this list contains no tasks.
* Returns an unmodifiable view of the tasks for read-only iteration.
* Returns the underlying mutable list of tasks.

*

Warning: This exposes the internal representation and should be used
* only where necessary (e.g., saving to disk). Prefer {@link #asUnmodifiableList()}
* Finds and returns tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* @return A TaskList containing all matching tasks.
* Represents a to-do task (a task without any associated date/time).
* Creates a to-do task with the given description.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code description} is {@code null} or blank.
* Returns the UI representation of this to-do task.
* @return Display string in the format {@code [T] [X] description} or {@code [T] [ ] description}.
* Returns the save-file representation of this to-do task.
* @return Storage string in the format {@code T | <doneFlag> | <description>}.
* Handles all user interaction for the Mochi chatbot.
/** Horizontal separator line used in CLI output. */
/** Input source for reading user commands. */
* Creates a UI that reads from the given {@link BufferedReader}.
* @param reader Reader used to read user input.
* Reads the next line of user input.
* @return The next input line, or {@code null} if EOF is reached.
* Prints a simple load status message after reading tasks from disk.
System.out.println("The following tasks are listed in the task list:");
* Prints a message confirming a task has been added.
* @param size Current size of task list.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("Currently, we have " + size + " task(s) on the list.");
* Prints a message confirming a task has been removed.
* @param size Current size of task list.
public void showTaskRemoved(Task removed, int size) {
System.out.println("Currently, we have " + size + " task(s) on the list.");
* Prints a message confirming a task has been marked or unmarked.
* @param isMarked True if marked as done, false if unmarked.
public void showTaskMarkStatus(Task task, boolean isMarked) {
* Prints the ASCII logo and greeting message.
System.out.println("Hello I'm MOCHI, your cutest personal chatbot (  )");
System.out.println("Is there anything I can help you with today?");
* Prints the list of accepted command formats.
* Prints a generic error message for invalid commands.
System.out.println("Error, please follow the specified formats:");

* Prints tasks that match a keyword search.
* @param matches The list of matching tasks.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
